tier.item: (2) Atta unsar þu in himinam,
father ours you in heavens
weihnai namo þein.
be-hallowed name your
qimai þiudinassus þeins.
may-come kingdom y our s
Wairþai wilja þeins,
may-become will yours
swe in himina jah ana airþai.
as in heaven also on earth
Hlaif unsarana þana sinteinan gif uns himma daga.
bread ours t he dai l y give us t hi s day
Jah aflet uns þatei skulans sijaima,
and forgive us that sinners are
swaswe jah weis afletam þaim skulam unsaraim.
like also we forgive the debtors our s
Jah ni briggais uns in fraistubnjai,
and not bring us in testing
Ak lausei uns af þamma ubilin.
but deliver us from the wicked-one
Amen

Atta unsar þu in himinam, weihnai namo þein. qimai þiudinassus þeins. Wairþai wilja þeins, swe in himina jah ana airþai. Hlaif unsarana þana sinteinan gif uns himma daga. Jah aflet uns þatei skulans sijaima, swaswe jah weis afletam þaim skulam unsaraim. Jah ni briggais uns in fraistubnjai, Ak lausei uns af þamma ubilin. Amen

father ours you in heavens be-hallowed name your may-come kingdom y our s may-become will yours as in heaven also on earth bread ours t he dai l y give us t hi s day and forgive us that sinners are like also we forgive the debtors our s and not bring us in testing but deliver us from the wicked-one

(Stone from Jelling, 10th c.)

tier.item: Ik gihorta ðat seggen, ðat sih urhettun ænon m uot i n,
I heard that say that themselves warriors alone engaged
Hiltibrant enti Hadubrant untar heriun tuem
Hiltibrant and Hadubrant between armies two
sunufatarungo iro saro rihtun.
son-and-fathers their armour arranged
garutun se iro guðhamun, gurtun sih iro suert ana,
readied they their battle-coverings girded themselves their swords on
(from the Hildebrandslied, ca. 800)
(6) Ik gihorta ðat seggen, ðat sih urhettun ænon m uot i n,

Ik gihorta ðat seggen, ðat sih urhettun ænon m uot i n, Hiltibrant enti Hadubrant untar heriun tuem sunufatarungo iro saro rihtun. garutun se iro guðhamun, gurtun sih iro suert ana,

I heard that say that themselves warriors alone engaged Hiltibrant and Hadubrant between armies two son-and-fathers their armour arranged readied they their battle-coverings girded themselves their swords on
(from the Hildebrandslied, ca. 800)

tier.item: (9) Thit was to there stunde
it was at the time
tha thi kening kerl riuchta bi gunde.
That the king Charles rule started
Tha waster ande there saxinna merik
Then was-there in the Saxon's district
liudingerus en hera fele steric.
Liudingerus a lord much strong
(beginning of epic poem from the Hunsinger Codex, 13th c.)
